intro: Wikstroemia foetida f. humilis, commonly known as the low-growing form of the stinkwood plant, is a shrub native to eastern Asia, including China, Japan, and Korea. It belongs to the Thymelaeaceae family and is characterized by its small, oval leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its bark and leaves contain various bioactive compounds, making it of interest in traditional medicine. The species is also noted for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions, showcasing its adaptability and resilience.
